author: monkeyontheloose.eth
content: are there daily merge tests happening?, i think i heard someone talk about this, can i participate to carry out my tests?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: They are fully automated, not possible to join: https://hivetests2.ethdevops.io/ https://github.com/parithosh/nightly-kurtosis-test/actions

author: monkeyontheloose.eth
content:
:/

Q: sorry for the noobness, before the relays come online, which component in the validator is going to be constructing the blocks?

author: monkeyontheloose.eth
content: reg execution client, like geth if ur running geth?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yes, geth will construct the blocks (even after the relays come online, mev-boost is opt-in, not required for block building)

author: jochembrouwer
content: Did the `engine` suite change into smaller suites? We now have `engine-sync`, `engine-auth`, `engine-transition`, `engine-api`?

author: jochembrouwer
content: Or did this change into `engine-api`?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yes it changed a bit, most tests ended up in `engine-api`, `auth` is jwt related tests, `transition` is merge transition related, `sync` is post-merge sync related tests. The general `engine` api tests ended up in `engine-api`

author: jochembrouwer
content: OK great, thanks ðŸ˜„

author: chris2_2_2
content: Given that more hashrate is coming onboard speeding up the merge to the 13th (and likely the 11th or 12th by the time its done) will TTD be adjusted or are we rolling with it? I assume a Sunday (11th) would be bad while the rest are doable.

author: chris2_2_2
content: Only issue is that hashrate is rapidly increasing and in a week it'll be too late to get everyone to adjust TTD. So I'm bringing this up now even though I'm pretty sure it'll be shot down.

author: .paulharris
content: just for context I'm not trying to shoot you down... I think that it'd be a risk to alter TTD now, so we'd want a really good reason, and I'm not sure there's enough CPU in the world to push it before sept 6, so at this point I think we'd let it just be earlier than the 15th if that happens..

author: chris2_2_2
content: Yeah I don't think its a very strong argument. We're probably looking at Monday at the worst.
